questions.question: Which of the following is not an organic binder?
For which of the following purpose strength tests are performed

answers.a: To ensure good strength so that mould does not collapse
answers.b: To ensure bonding strength so mould retains its shape
answers.c: To ensure that mould retain its shape when the patter is removed
answers.d: To ensure gases pass through easily in the mould

questions.question: Why do we perform the tensile strength of core sand

answers.a: To know the tensile load on the core during the pouring of molten metal
answers.b: To know the tensile load that occurs on the core during the contraction of metal
answers.c: To know the tensile strength of the moulding sand
answers.d: To know the tensile load that occurs on the molten metal by the core

questions.question: Insufficient shear strength of moulding sand leads to which of the following problems

answers.a: Collapsing of sand in the mould
answers.b: Partial destruction of mould during handling
answers.c: Erosion of moulding sand due to flow of molten metal

questions.question: What do you understand by the green compressive strength of foundry sand

answers.a: Property of the green sand to withstand the compressive stress
answers.b: Ability of the sand to be easily stripped off the casting after it has solidified
answers.c: Maximum compressive strength a mixture can develop before it collapses
answers.d: Minimum compressive strength a mixture can develop before it collapses
